album.title: Show: A Night in the Life of Matchbox Twenty

wiki.content: "Unwell" is the second single from Matchbox Twenty's third album, More Than You Think You Are. It was written by Matchbox Twenty lead singer Rob Thomas. It was very successful on the radio, spending 20 weeks at the top of the U.S. Billboard Adult Top 40 chart, two weeks atop the Billboard Hot Adult Contemporary Tracks chart, as well as reaching #5 on the Billboard Hot 100 chart. The song was nominated for Grammy Award in 2004 for Best Pop Performance by a Duo or Group with Vocal. The song is about a person who claims to not be crazy even though they're suffering from various occurrences that could lead them to be labeled as such. Rob Thomas states on the live DVD Show: A Night in the Life of Matchbox Twenty that he wrote the song to be a metaphor for humanity in general, a song for people who are "fucked up and feel alone like that. We all feel a little fucked up sometimes... you're not alone." This song is a staple of adult contemporary stations even years after its release. The song also was the second most played song in the United States in 2003 according to Billboard magazine. The music video was #1 on VH1's Top 40 Videos of 2003. The song's music video, directed by Meiert Avis, mostly features Thomas seeing various odd occurrences throughout, all the while singing along to the song. The rest of the band only appears in cameos, notably when Thomas boards a subway and they are seen in the background. The appearance of the other band mates is also altered like most of the video (their noses are rather large). The rest of the band is also seen at the end of the video gathered in Thomas' room, and each takes their turn waving goodbye to the camera before Thomas does so as well at the end of the video. User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License and may also be available under the GNU FDL.

track.name: Unwell
comments:
I'm not crazy, I'm just a little unwell; I know right now you can't tell, but stay awhile and maybe then you'll see a different side of me. I'm not crazy, I'm just a little impaired; I know right now you don't care, but soon enough you're gonna think of me, and how I used to be.
~I find myself singing this all the time LOL

@FinckBh- Check their greatest hits out.

This song...I didn't used to get it, but now I do. I really do.
I'm not crazy, I'm just a little impaired.
One of my favorite alt. bands right here. So many catchy choruses.
My favorite so Matchbox 20. cause its so describes me.
There is another song of this band that is as perfect as this? If the answer is yes, please let me know.
this has so fit my personally for so many years !!
I didn't know this song was from matchbox 20!!
